intro: Adenolinum sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian adenolinum, is a perennial herb native to the cold regions of Siberia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or tundra-like environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
